analyzed: yat paśyataḥ ca adhigamaḥ mama ayam tat me samāsena mune nibodha
translated: Listen to me, O Sage, as I tell you in brief what I have attained by seeing you,

original: sarvajña kāmaṃ viditam tavaitat svaṃ tūpacarāṃ pravivakṣur asmi // / //
analyzed: sarvajña kāmam viditam tava etat svam tu upacarām pravivakṣuḥ asmi
translated: O Omniscient One, this is well known to you. But I wish to state my own position.

original: anye 'pi santo vimumukṣavo hi śrutva vimokṣāya nayaṃ parasya /
analyzed: anye pi santaḥ vimumukṣavaḥ hi vimokṣāya nayam parasya
translated: Other good people also, who desire liberation, having heard the supreme path to liberation,

original: muktasya rogād iva rogavantas tenaiva mārgeṇa sukhaṃ ghaṭānte // / //
analyzed: muktasya rogāt iva rogavantaḥ tena eva mārgeṇa sukham ghaṭa ante
translated: Like those who are sick being freed from disease, happily reach the end of the path.

original: urvyādikān janmani vedmi dhātūn nātmānam urvyādiṣu teṣu kiṃ cit /
analyzed: urvī ādikān janmani vedmi dhātūn nā ātmānam urvī ādiṣu teṣu kim cit
translated: I know the elements such as earth etc. in birth, but I do not find the self in any of them such as earth etc.

original: yasmād atas teṣu na me 'sti saktir bahiś ca kāyena samā matir me // / //
analyzed: yasmāt atas teṣu na me sti saktiḥ bahis ca kāyena samā matiḥ me
translated: Therefore, I have no attachment to them, and my mind is the same towards the external body.

original: skandhāṃś ca rūpaprabhṛtīn daśārdhān paśyāmi yasmāc capalān asārān /
analyzed: skandhān ca rūpa prabhṛtīn daśārdhān paśyāmi yasmāt capalān asārān
translated: I see the aggregates beginning with form and the fifteen others as fleeting and insubstantial,

original: anātmakāṃś caiva vadhātmakāṃś ca tasmād vimukto 'smy aśivebhya ebhyaḥ // / //
analyzed: anātmakān ca eva vadha ātmakān ca tasmāt vimuktaḥ smi aśivebhyaḥ ebhyaḥ
translated: And as devoid of self and having the nature of killing. Therefore, I am liberated from these inauspicious things.

original: yasmāc ca paśyāmy udayaṃ vyayaṃ ca sarvāsv avasthāsv aham indriyāṇām /
analyzed: yasmāt ca paśyāmi udayam vyayam ca sarvāsu avasthāsu aham indriyāṇām
translated: And because I see the rise and fall of the senses in all states,

original: tasmād anityeṣu nirātmakeṣu duḥkheṣu me teṣv api nāsti saṃgaḥ // / //
analyzed: tasmāt anityeṣu nirātmakeṣu duḥkheṣu me teṣu api nā asti saṃgaḥ
translated: Therefore, I have no attachment to those impermanent, selfless, and suffering things.

original: yataś ca lokaṃ samjanmaniṣṭhaṃ paśyāmi niḥsāram asac ca sarvam /
analyzed: yatas ca lokam samjanma niṣṭham paśyāmi niḥsāram asat ca sarvam
translated: And because I see the world as having birth as its end, as empty, and as unreal in every way,

original: ato dhiyā me manasā vibaddham asmīti me neñjitam asti yena // / //
analyzed: atas dhiyā me manasā vibaddham asmi iti me na iñjitam asti yena
translated: Therefore, I am not attached to the thought that 'I am' which is bound by the mind and the intellect.

original: caturvidhe naikavidhaprasaṃge yato 'ham āhāravaidhāv asaktaḥ /
analyzed: caturvidhe nā ekavidha prasaṃge yatas ham āhāra vaidhau asaktaḥ
translated: Since I am not attached to the various kinds of food in the fourfold and manifold course,

original: amūrchitaś cāgrathitaś ca tatra tribhyo vimukto 'smi tato bhavebhyaḥ // / //
analyzed: a mūrchitaḥ ca a grathitaḥ ca tatra tribhyaḥ vimuktaḥ smi tatas bhavebhyaḥ
translated: I am unconfused and unfettered there, and therefore I am free from the three existences.

original: aniśritaś cāpratibaddhacitto dṛṣṭaśutādau vyavahāradharme /
analyzed: a niśritaḥ ca a pratibaddha cittaḥ dṛṣṭa śuta ādau vyavahāra dharme
translated: And since I am not dependent, my mind is unattached to the conventional dharmas that are seen and heard, etc.

original: yasmāt samātmānugataś ca tatra tasmād visaṃyogagato 'smi muktaḥ // / //
analyzed: yasmāt sama ātma anugataḥ ca tatra tasmāt visaṃyoga gataḥ smi muktaḥ
translated: And since I am equal-minded and follow that [path], therefore I am free, having attained disassociation.

original: ity evam uktvā gurubāhumānyāt sarveṇa kāyena sa gāṃ nipannaḥ /
analyzed: iti evam uktvā guru bāhumānyāt sarveṇa kāyena sa gām nipannaḥ
translated: Having thus spoken out of respect for the guru, he lay down on the ground with his whole body.

original: praverito lohitacandanākto haimo mahāstambha ivābhāse // / //🔽tataḥ pramādāt prasṛtasya pūrvaṃ śrutvā dhṛtiṃ vyākaraṇaṃ ca tasya /
analyzed: praveritaḥ lohita candana aktaḥ haimaḥ mahā stambhaḥ iva ābhāse  tatas pramādāt prasṛtasya pūrvam śrutvā dhṛtim vyākaraṇam ca tasya
translated: Anointed with red sandalwood paste, he shone like a great golden pillar.🔽Then, having heard his patience and prediction, and his faith in the lineage of the Dharma, which had previously spread out of heedlessness,

original: dharmānvayaṃ cānugataṃ prasādaṃ meghasvaras taṃ munir ābabhāṣe // / //
analyzed: dharma anvayam ca anugatam prasādam megha svaraḥ tam muniḥ ābabhāṣe
translated: Meghaśrī, the sage, spoke to him:

original: uttiṣṭha dharme sthita śiṣyajuṣṭe kiṃ pādayor me patito 'si mūrdhnā /
analyzed: uttiṣṭha dharme sthita śiṣya juṣṭe kim pādayoḥ me patitaḥ si mūrdhnā
translated: Rise up, abide in the Dharma, follow the disciples - why have you fallen at my feet with your head?

original: abhyarcanaṃ me na tathā praṇāmo dharme yathaiṣā pratipattir eva // / //
analyzed: abhyarcanam me na tathā praṇāmaḥ dharme yathā eṣā pratipattiḥ eva
translated: Worship and bowing down to me are not as much Dharma as this very practice.

original: adyāsi supravrajito jitātmann aiśvaryam apy ātmani yena labdham /
analyzed: adyā asi su pravrajitaḥ jita ātman aiśvaryam api ātmani yena labdham
translated: Today you have well gone forth, O self-controlled one, by whom sovereignty has been attained in the self.

original: jitātmanaḥ pravrajanaṃ hi sādhu calātmano na tv ajitendriyasya // / //
analyzed: jita ātmanaḥ pravrajanam hi sādhu cala ātmanaḥ na tu ajita indriyasya
translated: For the going forth of the self-controlled one is good, not of one with a fickle mind and uncontrolled senses.

original: adyāsi śaucena pareṇa yukto vākkāyacetāṃsi śucīni yat te /
analyzed: adyā asi śaucena pareṇa yuktaḥ vāc kāya cetāṃsi śucīni yat te
translated: Today you are endowed with the highest purity, since your speech, body and mind are pure.

original: ataḥ punaś cāprayatām asaumyāṃ yat saumya no vekṣyasi garbhaśayyām // / //
analyzed: atas punar ca a prayatām a saumyām yat saumya no vekṣyasi garbhaśayyām
translated: Therefore, O gentle one, you will not again behold that impure and inauspicious womb-bed.

original: adyārthavat te śrutavac chrutaṃ tac chrutānurūpaṃ pratipadya dharmam /
analyzed: adya arthavat te śrutavat śrutam tat śruta anurūpam pratipadya dharmam
translated: Today your learning is meaningful, your Dharma practice accords with the Dharma you have heard.

original: kṛtaśruto vipratipadyamāno nindyo hi nirvīrya ivāttaśastraḥ // / //
analyzed: kṛta śrutaḥ vipratipadyamānaḥ nindyaḥ hi nirvīryaḥ iva ātta śastraḥ
translated: For one who has studied but practices contrary to Dharma is to be blamed, like one who has taken up a weapon but lacks prowess.

original: aho dhṛtis te 'viṣayātmakasya yat tvaṃ matiṃ mokṣavidhāv akārṣīḥ /
analyzed: aho dhṛtiḥ te viṣaya ātmakasya yat tvam matim mokṣa vidhau akārṣīḥ
translated: Ah, your patience is amazing, that you have set your mind on the path to liberation, though it is beyond the scope of the self.

original: yāsyāmi niṣṭhām iti bāliśo hi janmakṣayāt trāsam ihābhyupaiti // / //
analyzed: yāsyāmi niṣṭhām iti bāliśaḥ hi janma kṣayāt trāsam iha abhyupaiti
translated: For the foolish one thinks, I will attain the ultimate state, and out of fear of the exhaustion of birth, he resorts to this [path].

original: diṣṭyā durāpaḥ kṣaṇasaṃnipāto nāyaṃ kṛto mohavaśena moghaḥ /
analyzed: diṣṭyā durāpaḥ kṣaṇa saṃnipātaḥ na ayam kṛtaḥ moha vaśena moghaḥ
translated: By good fortune, this fleeting moment has not been wasted by you under the sway of delusion.

original: udeti duḥkhena gato hy adhastāt kūrmo yugacchidra ivārñavasthaḥ // / //
analyzed: udeti duḥkhena gataḥ hi adhastāt kūrmaḥ yuga chidre iva ārñava sthaḥ
translated: Arises with difficulty and goes below, like a tortoise in the ocean through the hole of a yoke.

original: nirjitya māraṃ yudhi durnivāram adyāsi loke raṇaśīrṣūraḥ /
analyzed: nirjitya māram yudhi durnivāram adyā asi loke raṇa śīrṣūraḥ
translated: Today, having conquered Māra in battle, which is hard to resist, you are the hero of the battlefield in the world.

original: śūro 'py āsūraḥ sa hi veditavyo doṣair amitrair iva hanyate yaḥ // / //
analyzed: śūraḥ u pi āsūraḥ sa hi veditavyaḥ doṣaiḥ amitraiḥ iva hanyate yaḥ
translated: He who is struck down by faults like enemies should be known as a hero who is not a hero.

original: nirvāpya rāgāgnim udīrṇam adyāsi loke raṇaśīrṣaśūraḥ /
analyzed: nirvāpya rāga agnim udīrṇam adyā asi loke raṇa śīrṣa śūraḥ
translated: Today, having extinguished the raging fire of passion, you are the hero of the battlefield in the world.

original: duḥkhaṃ hi śete śayane 'py udāre kleśāgninā cetasi dhayamānaḥ // / //
analyzed: duḥkham hi śete śayane pi udāre kleśa agninā cetasi dhayamānaḥ
translated: For one who is tormented in the mind by the fire of afflictions sleeps unhappily even on an excellent bed.

original: abhyucchrito dravyamadena pūrvam adyāsi tṛṣnoparamāt samṛddhaḥ /
analyzed: abhyucchritaḥ dravya madena pūrvam adyā asi tṛṣnā uparamāt samṛddhaḥ
translated: Having been previously exalted by the intoxication of wealth, you are now prosperous through the cessation of craving.

original: yāvat satarṣaḥ puruṣo hi loke tāvat samṛddho 'pi sadā daridraḥ // / //
analyzed: yāvat sa tarṣaḥ puruṣaḥ hi loke tāvat samṛddhaḥ pi sadā daridraḥ
translated: For as long as a man has craving in the world, he is poor, even if prosperous.

original: adyāpadeṣṭuṃ tava yuktarūpaṃ śuddhodhano me nṛpatiḥ piteti /
analyzed: adya apadeṣṭum tava yukta rūpam śuddhodhanaḥ me nṛpatiḥ pitā iti
translated: It is fitting for you to declare today: My father was the king Śuddhodana.

original: bhraṣṭasya dharmāt pitṛbhir nipātād aślāghaniyo hi kulāpadeśaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhraṣṭasya dharmāt pitṛbhiḥ nipātāt a ślāgha niyaḥ hi kula apadeśaḥ
translated: For the boasting of one's family is not to be praised when one has fallen from the Dharma of one's ancestors.

original: diṣṭyāsi śāntiṃ paramām upeto nistīrṇakāntāra ivāptasāraḥ /
analyzed: diṣṭyā asi śāntim paramām upetaḥ nistīrṇa kāntāraḥ iva āpta sāraḥ
translated: By good fortune you have attained the highest peace, like one who has crossed the wilderness and obtained wealth.

original: sarvo hi saṃsāragato bhayārto yathaiva kāntāragatas tathaiva // / //
analyzed: sarvaḥ hi saṃsāra gataḥ bhaya ārtaḥ yathā eva kāntāra gataḥ tathā eva
translated: For everyone in the cycle of existence is afflicted by fear, just as one is when traveling through a wilderness.

original: āraṇyakaṃ kbhaikṣacaraṃ vinītaṃ dkraṣyāmi nandaṃ nibhṛtaṃ kadeti /
analyzed: āraṇyakam k bhaikṣa caram vinītam nandam nibhṛtam kadā iti
translated: When will I see Nanda, who has gone forth, living in the forest, begging for alms, humble and restrained?

original: āsīt purastāt tvayi me didṛkṣā tathāsi diṣṭyā mama darśanīyaḥ // / //
analyzed: āsīt purastāt tvayi me didṛkṣā tathā asi diṣṭyā mama darśanīyaḥ
translated: In the past, I had a desire to see you. By good fortune, you have become visible to me.

original: bhavaty arūpo 'pi hi darśanīyaḥ svalaṅkṛtaḥ śreṣṭhatamair guṇaiḥ svaiḥ /
analyzed: bhavati arūpaḥ u pi hi darśanīyaḥ su alaṅkṛtaḥ śreṣṭhatamaiḥ guṇaiḥ svaiḥ
translated: Even one who is ugly can be beautiful if well-adorned with one's own excellent qualities.

original: doṣaiḥ parīto malinīkarais tu sudarśanīyo 'pi virūpa eva // / //
analyzed: doṣaiḥ parītaḥ malinīkaraiḥ tu virūpaḥ eva
translated: But even one who is very handsome is ugly if covered with defiling faults.

original: adya prakṛṣtā tava buddhimattā kṛtsnaṃ yayā te kṛtam ātmakāryam /
analyzed: adya prakṛṣtā tava buddhimat tā kṛtsnam yayā te kṛtam ātma kāryam
translated: Today, your intelligence has reached its peak, by which you have accomplished all your own goals.

original: śrutonnatasyāpi hi nāsti buddhir notpadyate śreyasi yasya buddhiḥ // / //
analyzed: śruta unnatasya api hi nā asti buddhiḥ nā utpadyate śreyasi yasya buddhiḥ
translated: For one whose mind is elevated by learning, but who does not have the intelligence to attain what is excellent, has no intelligence at all.

original: unmīlitasyāpi janasya madhye nimīlitasyāpi tathaiva cakṣuḥ /
analyzed: unmīlitasya api janasya madhye nimīlitasya api tathā eva cakṣuḥ
translated: Even though one's eyes are open, they are as if closed in the midst of people,

original: prajñāmayaṃ yasya hi nāsti cakṣuś cakṣur na tasyāsti sacakṣuṣo 'pi // / //
analyzed: prajñā mayam yasya hi na asti cakṣuḥ cakṣuḥ na tasya asti sa cakṣuṣaḥ pi
translated: if one does not have the eye of wisdom. Even one who has eyes does not have eyes.

original: duḥkhapratīkāranimittam ārtaḥ kṛṣyādibhiḥ khedam upaiti lokaḥ /
analyzed: duḥkha pratīkāra nimittam ārtaḥ kṛṣi ādibhiḥ khedam upaiti lokaḥ
translated: The world, afflicted by the desire to remedy suffering, becomes weary through agriculture and so on.

original: ajasram āgacchati tac ca bhūyo jñānena yasyādya kṛtas tvayāntaḥ // / //
analyzed: ajasram āgacchati tat ca bhūyas jñānena yasya adya kṛtaḥ tvayā antaḥ
translated: And that which constantly comes again and again, has now been put to an end by you through knowledge.

original: duḥkhaṃ na me syāt sukham eva me syād iti pravṛttaḥ stataṃ hi lokaḥ /
analyzed: duḥkham na me syāt sukham eva me syāt iti pravṛttaḥ statam hi lokaḥ
translated: For the world indeed engages in action, thinking, May I have no suffering, but only happiness.

original: na vetti tac caiva tathā yathā syāt prāptaṃ tvayādyāsulabhaṃ yatāvat // / //
analyzed: na vetti tat ca eva tathā yathā syāt prāptam tvayā adya asulabham yata avat
translated: And it does not know that as it should be. But now, you have attained what is difficult to attain, as much as is possible.

original: ity evamādi sthirabuddhicittas tathāgatenābhihito hitāya /
analyzed: iti evamādi sthira buddhi cittaḥ tathāgatena abhihitaḥ hitāya
translated: Thus, with a firm mind and heart, the Thus-Gone One has spoken like this for the benefit of Nanda.

original: staveṣu nindāsu ca nirvyapekṣaḥ kṛtāñjalir vākyam uvāca nandaḥ // / //
analyzed: staveṣu nindāsu ca nirvyapekṣaḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ vākyam uvāca nandaḥ
translated: In praise and blame, he is indifferent. With palms joined, Nanda spoke these words:

original: aho viśeṣeṇa viṣeṣadarśiṃs tvayānukampā mayi darṣiteyam /
analyzed: aho viśeṣeṇa viṣa iṣa darśin tvayā anukampā mayi darṣitā iyam
translated: Ah! With special insight, you have shown me this compassion.

original: yat kāmapaṇke bhagavan nimagnas trāto 'smi saṃsārabhayād akāmaḥ // / //
analyzed: yat kāma paṇke bhagavat nimagnaḥ trātaḥ smi saṃsāra bhayāt akāmaḥ
translated: O Blessed One, I was sinking in the mud of desire, but you have saved me from the fear of saṃsāra, against my will.

original: bhrātrā tvayā śreyasi daiśikena pitrā phalasthena tataiva mātrā /
analyzed: bhrātrā tvayā śreyasi daiśikena pitrā phala sthena tatā eva mātrā
translated: By you, my brother, who is a guide to what is good, by my father who is established in the fruit, and by my mother,

original: hato 'bhaviṣyaṃ yadi na vyamokṣyaṃ sārthāt paribhraṣṭa ivākṛtārthaḥ // / //
analyzed: hataḥ bhaviṣyam yadi na vyamokṣyam sārthāt paribhraṣṭaḥ iva akṛtārthaḥ
translated: I would have been destroyed if I had not been liberated, like a caravan that has strayed from the path and has not attained its goal.

original: śāntasya tuṣṭasya sukho viveko vijñātattvasya parīkṣakasya /
analyzed: śāntasya tuṣṭasya sukhaḥ vivekaḥ vijñā tattvasya parīkṣakasya
translated: But for one who is peaceful, content, and happy, there is the solitude of one who has understood the truth and is an inquirer.

original: prahīṇamānasya ca nirmadasya sukhaṃ virāgatvam asaktabuddheḥ // / //
analyzed: prahīṇa mānasya ca nirmadasya sukham virāga tvam asakta buddheḥ
translated: For one who has abandoned pride and is free from intoxication, the happiness of dispassion, with an unattached mind, is supreme.

original: ato hi tattvaṃ parigamya samyañ nirdhūya doṣān adhigamya śāntim /
analyzed: atas hi tattvam parigamya samyak nirdhūya doṣān adhigamya śāntim
translated: Having fully understood this truth, having shaken off faults and attained peace,

original: svaṃ nāśrayaṃ saṃprati cintayāmi na taṃ janaṃ nāpsaraso na devān // / //
analyzed: svam nā āśrayam saṃprati cintayāmi na tam janam nā apsarasaḥ na devān
translated: I now consider my own refuge, not that person, not the celestial nymphs, not the gods.

original: idaṃ hi bhuktvā suci śāmikaṃ sukhaṃ na me manaḥ kāṃṣati kāmjaṃ sukham /
analyzed: idam hi bhuktvā suci śāmikam sukham na me manaḥ kāṃṣati kām jam sukham
translated: Having enjoyed this pure and wholesome happiness, my mind does not long for the happiness of sensual pleasures.

original: mahārham apy annam adaivāhṛtaṃ divaukaso bhuktavataḥ sudhām iva // / //
analyzed: mahārham api annam adaiva āhṛtam divaukasaḥ bhuktavataḥ sudhām iva
translated: Even costly food prepared by others does not appeal to one who has eaten nectar from the gods.

original: aho 'ndhavijñānanimīlitaṃ jagat paṭāntare paśyati nottamaṃ sukham /
analyzed: aho ndha vijñāna nimīlitam jagat paṭa antare paśyati nā uttamam sukham
translated: Alas, the world is blinded by ignorance, seeing only the end of the cloth, not the supreme happiness.

original: sudhīram adhyātmasukhaṃ vyapāsya hi śramaṃ tathā kāmasukhārtham ṛcchati // / //
analyzed: su dhīram adhyātma sukham vyapāsya hi śramam tathā kāma sukha artham ṛcchati
translated: Abandoning the wise happiness of the soul, one goes to toil for the sake of sensual happiness.

original: yathā hi ratnākaram etya durmatir vihāya ratnāny asato maṇin haret /
analyzed: yathā hi ratnākaram etya durmatiḥ vihāya ratnāni asataḥ haret
translated: Just as a foolish person, having come to the ocean of jewels, would discard the jewels and steal a worthless gem,

original: apāsya saṃbodhisukhaṃ tahottamaṃ śramaṃ vrajet kāmasukhopaabdhaye // / //
analyzed: apāsya saṃbodhi sukham śramam vrajet kāma sukha upaabdhaye
translated: so one would abandon the supreme happiness of enlightenment and go to toil for the sake of sensual happiness.

original: aho hi satteṣv atimaitracetasas tathāgatasyānujighṛkṣutā parā /
analyzed: aho hi satteṣu ati maitra cetasaḥ tathāgatasya anujighṛkṣu tā parā
translated: Alas, the Tathāgata has the highest desire to help beings, with a mind of great friendliness towards them.

original: apāsya yad dhyānasukhaṃ mune paraṃ parasya duḥkhoparamāya khidyase // / //
analyzed: apāsya yat dhyāna sukham mune param parasya duḥkha uparamāya khidyase
translated: Having abandoned the supreme bliss of meditation, you toil for the cessation of others' suffering.

original: mayā na śakyaṃ pratikartum adya kiṃ gurau hitaiṣiṇy anukampake tvayi /
analyzed: mayā na śakyam pratikartum adya kim gurau hita eṣiṇi anukampake tvayi
translated: What can I do now to repay you, my spiritual teacher who wishes for my welfare and has compassion for me?

original: samuddhṛto yena bhavārṇavād ahaṃ mahārṇavāc cūrṇitanaur ivormibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: samuddhṛtaḥ yena bhava arṇavāt aham mahā arṇavāt cūrṇita nauḥ iva ūrmibhiḥ
translated: You who have rescued me from the ocean of existence, like a ship battered by waves in the great ocean.

original: tato munis tasya niśamya hetumat prahīṇasarvāsravasūcakaṃ vacaḥ /🔽idaṃ babhāṣe vadatām anuttamo yad arhati śrīghana eva bhāṣitum // / //
analyzed: tatas muniḥ tasya niśamya hetumat prahīṇa sarva āsrava sūcakam vacaḥ  idam babhāṣe vadatām anuttamaḥ yat arhati śrīghanaḥ eva bhāṣitum
translated: Then the sage, having heard his words indicating the complete abandonment of all defilements,🔽The unsurpassed speaker said this: This is what the one of great wealth should speak.

original: idaṃ kṛtārthaḥ paramārthavit kṛtī tvam eva dhīmann abhidhātum arhasi /
analyzed: idam kṛtārthaḥ parama artha vid kṛtī tvam eva dhīman abhidhātum arhasi
translated: You, O wise one, who have accomplished your purpose, who know the ultimate truth, and who are successful, should speak this.

original: atītya kāntāram avāptasādhanaḥ sudaiśikasyeva kṛtaṃ mahāvaṇik // / //
analyzed: atītya kāntāram avāpta sādhanaḥ su daiśikasya iva kṛtam mahā vaṇij
translated: Like a great merchant who has crossed the wilderness and obtained the means,

original: avaiti buddhaṃ naradamyasārthiṃ kṛtī yathārhann upśāntamānasaḥ /
analyzed: avaiti buddham nara damyasārthim kṛtī yathā arhan upśānta mānasaḥ
translated: One who has attained the goal, with a mind completely pacified, knows the Buddha, the leader of human beings to be tamed.

original: na dṛṣṭasatyo 'pi tathāvabudhyate pṛthagjanaḥ kiṃ bata buddhimān api // / //
analyzed: na dṛṣṭa satyaḥ tathā avabudhyate pṛthagjanaḥ kim bata buddhimān api
translated: A worldly person who has not seen the truth does not understand it in the same way, let alone an intelligent person.

original: rajastamobhyāṃ parimuktacetasas tavaiva ceyaṃ sadṛsī kṛtajñatā /
analyzed: rajaḥ tamobhyām parimukta cetasaḥ tava eva ca iyam sadṛsī kṛtajña tā
translated: Your gratitude is similar to that of one whose mind is freed from passion and darkness.

original: rajaḥprakarṣeṇa jagaty avasthite kṛtajñabhāvo hi kṛtajña durlabhaḥ // / //
analyzed: rajaḥ prakarṣeṇa jagati avasthite kṛtajña bhāvaḥ hi kṛtajña durlabhaḥ
translated: For gratitude is rare in the world when passion prevails.

original: ato 'sti bhūyas tvayi me vivakṣitaṃ nato hi bhaktaś ca niyogam arhasi // / //
analyzed: atas sti bhūyas tvayi me vivakṣitam nataḥ hi bhaktaḥ ca niyogam arhasi
translated: Therefore, I have more to say to you. Indeed, a devoted servant deserves to be commanded.

original: avāptakāryo 'si parāṃ gatiṃ gato na te 'sti kiṃ cit karaṇīyam aṇv api /
analyzed: avāpta kāryaḥ si parām gatim gataḥ na te sti kim cit karaṇīyam aṇu api
translated: You have attained your goal and reached the highest state. There is not the slightest thing left for you to do.

original: ataḥparaṃ saumya carānukampayā vimokṣayan kṛcchragatān parān api // / //🔽ihārtham evārabhate naro 'dhamo vimadhyamas tūbhayalaukikīṃ kriyām /
analyzed: atas param saumya cara anukampayā vimokṣayan kṛcchra gatān parān api  iha artham eva ārabhate naraḥ dhamaḥ vimadhyamaḥ tu ubhaya laukikīm kriyām
translated: Therefore, O gentle one, move about out of compassion, liberating others who are in distress.🔽A low person undertakes actions only for this world, a middling person performs actions for both worlds.

original: kriyām amutraiva phalāya madhyamo viśiṣṭadharmā punar apravṛttaye // / //🔽ihottamebhyo 'pi mataḥ sa tūttamo ya uttamaṃ dharmam avāpya naiṣṭhikam /
analyzed: kriyām amutra eva phalāya madhyamaḥ viśiṣṭa dharmā punar apravṛttaye  iha uttamebhyaḥ mataḥ sa tu uttamaḥ yaḥ uttamam dharmam avāpya naiṣṭhikam
translated: A middling person performs actions only for the sake of results in the next world, but an excellent person, having attained the highest dharma, acts for the sake of non-recurrence.

original: acintayitvātmagataṃ pariśramaṃ śamaṃ parebhyo 'py upadeṣṭum icchati // / //
analyzed: a cintayitvā ātma gatam pariśramam śamam parebhyaḥ pi upadeṣṭum icchati
translated: But he who, having attained the highest dharma, desires to teach it to others, disregarding his own fatigue, is considered even higher than the highest.

original: vihāya tasmād iha kāryam ātmanaḥ kuru sthirātman parakāryam apy atho /
analyzed: vihāya tasmāt iha kāryam ātmanaḥ kuru sthira ātman para kāryam api atho
translated: Therefore, O steadfast one, give up your own work and do the work of others.

original: bhramatsu sattveṣu tamovṛtātmasu śrutapradīpo niśi dhāryatām ayam // / //
analyzed: bhramatsu sattveṣu tamaḥ vṛta ātmasu śruta pradīpaḥ niśi dhāryatām ayam
translated: While beings wander, their minds enveloped in darkness, may this lamp of learning be held aloft in the night.

original: bravītu tāvat puri vismito janas tvayi sthite kurvati dharmadeśanāḥ /
analyzed: bravītu tāvat puri vismitaḥ janaḥ tvayi sthite kurvati dharma deśanāḥ
translated: Let the people in the city, amazed, speak thus: While you are present, teaching the Dharma,

original: aho batāścaryam idaṃ vimuktaye karoti rāgī yad ayam kathām iti // / //
analyzed: aho bata āścaryam idam vimuktaye karoti rāgī yat ayam kathām iti
translated: Oh, what a wonder! That one filled with passion should give this discourse for the sake of liberation!

original: dhruvaṃ hi saṃśrutya tava sthiraṃ mano nivṛttanānāviṣayair manorathaiḥ /
analyzed: dhruvam hi saṃśrutya tava sthiram manaḥ nivṛtta nānā viṣayaiḥ manorathaiḥ
translated: For, having heard your firm mind, turned away from various sensual desires,

original: vadhūr gṛhe sāpi tavānukurvatī kariṣyate strīṣu virāgiṇīḥ kathāḥ // / //
analyzed: vadhūḥ gṛhe sā api tava anukurvatī kariṣyate strīṣu virāgiṇīḥ kathāḥ
translated: Your wife, following your example in the house, will surely speak discourses on detachment from women.

original: tvayi paramadhṛtau niviṣṭatattve bhavanagatā na hi raṃsyate dhruvaṃ sā /
analyzed: tvayi parama dhṛtau niviṣṭa tattve bhavana gatā na hi raṃsyate dhruvam sā
translated: When you, firmly established in the highest truth, are dwelling there, she will surely not delight in staying at home.

original: manasi śamadamātmaike vivikte matir iva kāmasukhaiḥ parīkṣakasya // / //
analyzed: manasi śama dama ātma eke vivikte matiḥ iva kāma sukhaiḥ parīkṣakasya
translated: When the mind is alone, tranquil and disciplined, like the discriminating mind of one seeking knowledge, free from sensual pleasures.

original: ity arhataḥ paramakāruṇikasya śāstur mūrdhnā vacaś ca caraṇau ca samaṃ gṛhītvā /
analyzed: iti arhataḥ parama kāruṇikasya śāstuḥ mūrdhnā vacaḥ ca caraṇau ca samam gṛhītvā
translated: Thus, having taken with his head the words and feet of the Arhat, the supremely compassionate teacher,

original: svasthaḥ praśāntahṛdayo vinivṛttakāryaḥ pārśvān muneḥ pratiyayau vimadaḥ karīva // / //
analyzed: svasthaḥ praśānta hṛdayaḥ vinivṛtta kāryaḥ pārśvāt muneḥ pratiyayau vimadaḥ karī iva
translated: The elephant-like one, well, with a tranquil heart, his purpose accomplished, turned away from the side of the sage and departed.

original: bhikṣarthaṃ samaye viveśa sa puraṃ dṛṣṭīr janasyākṣipan lābhālābhasukhāsukhādiṣu samaḥ svasthendriyo niḥspṛhaḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣā artham samaye viveśa sa puram dṛṣṭīḥ janasya ākṣipan lābha a lābha sukha asukha ādiṣu samaḥ svastha indriyaḥ niḥspṛhaḥ
translated: For the sake of alms, he entered the city at the proper time, casting aside the views of people, equal in gain and loss, happiness and sorrow, with senses at ease, and desireless.

original: nirmokṣāya cakāra tatra ca kathāṃ kāle janāyārthine naivonmārgagatān parān paribhavan nātmānam utkarṣayan // / //
analyzed: nirmokṣāya cakāra tatra ca kathām kāle janāya arthine na eva unmārga gatān parān paribhavan na ātmānam utkarṣayan
translated: And there, for the sake of liberation, he gave a discourse to a person who asked at the proper time, not disparaging others who had gone astray, not exalting himself.

original: ity eṣā vyupaśāntaye na rataye mokṣārthagarbhā kṛtiḥ śrotṝṇāṃ grahaṇārtham anyamanasāṃ kāvyopacārāt kṛtā /
analyzed: iti eṣā vyupaśāntaye na rataye mokṣa artha garbhā kṛtiḥ śrotṝṇām grahaṇa artham anya manasām kāvya upacārāt kṛtā
translated: Thus, this composition, which is full of the meaning of liberation, is for the sake of tranquility, not for enjoyment, composed by way of poetry for the sake of grasping by listeners whose minds are elsewhere.

original: yan mokṣāt kṛtam anyad atra hi mayā tat kāvyadharmāt kṛtaṃ pātuṃ tiktam ivauṣadhaṃ madhuyutaṃ hṛdyaṃ kathaṃ syād iti // / //
analyzed: yat mokṣāt kṛtam anyat atra hi mayā tat kāvya dharmāt kṛtam pātum tiktam iva auṣadham madhu yutam hṛdyam katham syāt iti
translated: Whatever else I have done here apart from liberation, that I have done by the law of poetry, thinking how to make it palatable like bitter medicine mixed with honey.

original: prāyeṇālokya lokaṃ viṣayaratiparaṃ mo kṣāt pratihataṃ kāvyavājena tattvaṃ kathitam iha mayā mokṣaḥ param iti /
analyzed: prāyeṇa ālokya lokam viṣaya rati param kṣāt pratihatam kāvya vājena tattvam kathitam iha mayā mokṣaḥ param iti
translated: Having seen that the world is generally averse to liberation because of its delight in sensual pleasures, I have here told the truth by the way of poetry, that liberation is supreme.

original: tad buddhvā śāmikaṃ yat tad avahitam ito grāhyaṃ na lalitaṃ pāṃsubhyo dhātujebhyo niyatam upakaraṃ cāmīkaram iti // / //
analyzed: tat buddhvā śāmikam yat tat avahitam itas grāhyam na lalitam pāṃsubhyaḥ dhātu jebhyaḥ niyatam upakaram cāmīkaram iti
translated: Having understood that, one should carefully grasp from here what is beneficial, not what is charming, just as one should certainly take gold, which is beneficial, from sand, which is born from elements.

original: Saundaranande mahākāvya ājñāvyākaraṇo nāmāṣṭādaśaḥ sargaḥ /
analyzed: saundaranande mahākāvye ājñāvyākaraṇaḥ nāma aṣṭādaśaḥ sargaḥ
translated: In the great poem Saundarananda, this is the eighteenth canto named The Prophecy of the Teacher's Disciples.

original: āryasuvarṇākṣīputrasya sāketakasya bhikṣor ācāryabhadantāśvaghoṣasya mahākaver mahāvādinaḥ kṛtir iyam //
analyzed: ārya suvarṇākṣīputrasya sāketakasya bhikṣoḥ ācārya bhadanta aśvaghoṣasya mahā kaveḥ mahā vādinaḥ kṛtiḥ iyam
translated: This is the work of the noble monk Suvarṇākṣīputra of Sāketa, the teacher Bhadanta Aśvaghoṣa, the great poet and great speaker.
